programme.title: Moribito: Guardian of the Spirit
programme.desc: Winter has thawed at last, spring flowers breaking through the frost; Balsa and Chagum leave Hunter's Hole and travel toward Aoike Pond, but trouble lurks not far behind.

programme.title: Moribito: Guardian of the Spirit
programme.desc: When Egg Eater closes in on Chagum, a message from Gakai to Shuga provides a little clarity regarding the Place of Celebration, but the information arrives too late.

programme.title: Moribito: Guardian of the Spirit
programme.desc: With the secret to defeating the Egg Eaters in tow, Balsa pursues Chagum to the true Place of Celebration; at the place where worlds intersect, they make their final stand.

programme.title: Moribito: Guardian of the Spirit
programme.desc: Chagum is named Crown Prince and Divine Hero of the People; as he reunites with his mother, Balsa contemplates the future.

programme.title: Outbreak Company
programme.desc: A lowly otaku is transported to a magic kingdom to bring his nerdy hobbies to the populace in a cultural exchange program.

programme.title: Outbreak Company
programme.desc: Shinichi begins the arduous task of finding the right stuff to bring to the Eldant Emipre; the Queen appears and demands that he read to her.

programme.title: Outbreak Company
programme.desc: Shinichi's vision of a school in Eldant is realized, but some citizens see it as a threat to their dominance over others.

programme.title: Outbreak Company
programme.desc: After an advanced lesson on Otaku culture, Shinichi finds himself defending a foreign spy that also happens to be a wolf girl.

programme.title: Outbreak Company
programme.desc: While his students adopt the otaku culture at breakneck speed, Shinichi has a sneaking suspicion that Elbia is playing both sides.

programme.title: Outbreak Company
programme.desc: To foster improved relations between the elves and dwarves, Shinichi proposes a friendly soccer game.

programme.title: Outbreak Company
programme.desc: Shinichi succesfully petitions to be allowed back to Japan for better materials, unknowingly bringing Myucel along for the ride.

programme.title: Outbreak Company
programme.sub-title: The Melancholy of Her Imperial Majesty
programme.desc: Petralka stumbles into the hikikomori lifestyle; the only way for Shinichi to bring her back is to dive in head first.

programme.title: Outbreak Company
programme.desc: An ambush awaits amid a parade of swimsuits.

programme.title: Outbreak Company
programme.desc: The soccer match footage is leaked in the real world; Shinichi decides to make it part of a movie, with Petralka as the main character.

programme.title: Outbreak Company
programme.desc: As Shinichi witnesses a breakdown in social normalcy among the Eldant citizens, Matoba reveals the real reason that otaku culture is being brought to this new world.

programme.title: Outbreak Company
programme.desc: With the Japanese Government's true intentions clear, Shinichi must be protected from harm at all times.

programme.title: Giant Beasts of Ars
programme.sub-title: The Promise That Started It All
programme.desc: A young escapee and a listless hunter meet by chance, unaware of the covenant that will soon bind them.

programme.title: Giant Beasts of Ars
programme.desc: Their pact grants Jiro and Kumi the power to defend the town from the giant beast and exposes their location to Imperial forces.

programme.title: Giant Beasts of Ars
programme.desc: Low on supplies and with their escape route cut off, the three companions seek shelter in a nearby village.

programme.title: Giant Beasts of Ars
programme.desc: Jiro underestimates a mysterious traveler and loses his spear in a game of chance; she has an agenda, but has an interest with a Cleric and a Paladin which is Hina Yomiya, Toshiyuki Morikawa.

programme.title: Giant Beasts of Ars
programme.desc: Jiro has a violent history with the people of the mountains; when the group finds themselves in their village, the inhabitants challenge the Paladin to a test of strength.

programme.title: Giant Beasts of Ars
programme.desc: Kumi fears a connection between her and the red-eyed beasts.

programme.title: Giant Beasts of Ars
programme.sub-title: Violet Evokes the Memory of Horns
programme.desc: A look a Jiro's previous marriage to Toka.

programme.title: Giant Beasts of Ars
programme.desc: A fateful encounter changes Kumi's life.

programme.title: Giant Beasts of Ars
programme.desc: Jiro and his friends plan to end the Imperial experiments.

programme.title: Giant Beasts of Ars
programme.desc: Kumi and the others launch an assault on the laboratory to save the prototypes.

programme.title: Giant Beasts of Ars
programme.desc: Kumi can either live the little time she may have left as a normal girl or continue fighting.

programme.title: Giant Beasts of Ars
programme.desc: Giant beasts attack the people of Ars en masse, forcing everyone to fight for their lives.

programme.title: The Most Heretical Last Boss Queen: From Villainess to Savior
programme.desc: The crown princess hides the fact that her positive transformation stems from being reincarnated, not her newfound precognition.

programme.title: The Most Heretical Last Boss Queen: From Villainess to Savior
programme.sub-title: The Villainous Princess Makes a Request of Her Brother
programme.desc: Stale is resolute in avenging his mother, driven to succeed at any cost, and ponders whether recalling a forgotten dream could aid him.

programme.title: The Most Heretical Last Boss Queen: From Villainess to Savior
programme.sub-title: The Heretical Princess and the Knights
programme.desc: After a military exercise mishap, Pride must ensure everyone returns safely.

programme.title: The Most Heretical Last Boss Queen: From Villainess to Savior
programme.sub-title: The Worst Princess and the Young Man's Vow
programme.desc: In another life, Pride's callousness results in tragedy and a powerful enemy; in this life, her compassion saves those fated to die and earns her an unexpected ally.

programme.title: The Most Heretical Last Boss Queen: From Villainess to Savior
programme.sub-title: The Wicked Princess and the Sword
programme.desc: Arthur abandoned his dream to be a knight due to his embarrassing special ability; now. inspired by Pride's actions, he embraces his ambition once again.

programme.title: The Most Heretical Last Boss Queen: From Villainess to Savior
programme.desc: Pride faces a crucial test as the future queen, passing judgment on an enemy, yet fears it may lead her down a path of ruin.

programme.title: The Most Heretical Last Boss Queen: From Villainess to Savior
programme.sub-title: The Coldhearted Princess and the Quitter
programme.desc: Desperation often springs from the timeless and powerful source: love.

programme.title: The Most Heretical Last Boss Queen: From Villainess to Savior
programme.desc: Arthur's crop-growing skill, dismissed as useless for a knight, proves pivotal as Pride's actions set off life-changing events.

programme.title: The Most Heretical Last Boss Queen: From Villainess to Savior
programme.sub-title: The Cruel Princess and the Criminal
programme.desc: Pride's directive to a criminal to seek her out in impossible situations has come to fruition.

programme.title: The Most Heretical Last Boss Queen: From Villainess to Savior
programme.desc: Pride and friends craft a plan to rescue the kidnapped children.

programme.title: The Most Heretical Last Boss Queen: From Villainess to Savior
programme.sub-title: The Merciless Princess And The Order
programme.desc: In the face of a crisis unlike any before, Val refuses to abandon anyone.

programme.title: The Most Heretical Last Boss Queen: From Villainess to Savior
programme.sub-title: The Treacherous Princess Faces the Future
programme.desc: Despite transforming lives for the better, Pride doubts it's sufficient to escape her destiny.
